OpenAI‚Äôs New ChatGPT Images Is Here! But‚Ä¶ Will It Top Nano Banana Pro?
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | December 19, 2025
ChatGPT Images, also known as OpenAI‚Äôs Image 1.5, introduces advanced capabilities to generate visually striking content. A thorough comparison with Google‚Äôs Nanobanana Pro reveals intriguing differences amid exciting developments in AI technology, including the latest on GPT-5.2 Codex and the Gemini 3 Flash model.

News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
The Top 10 Wildest GPT-5.2 Demos
| TheNeuronDaily.com | December 12, 2025
The latest showcase of GPT-5.2 features incredible demonstrations ranging from building a 3D graphics engine to playing Pok√©mon Crystal live on stream. The article highlights both remarkable feats and some outputs that appeared impressive but were misleading, indicating the potential and challenges of this advanced AI model.
B.)
Top 15 New Technology Trends That Will Define 2027 {Part 2}
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | December 15, 2025
Explore groundbreaking advancements that will shape 2027, including developments in artificial intelligence, robotics, and digital security. These emerging trends are redefining industries and creating new opportunities, making it crucial for tech enthusiasts and professionals to stay informed on the innovations that will drive the future.
C.)
The Renaissance of the American Factory
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 15, 2025
In 2026, Erin Price-Wright of a16z predicts a resurgence in American manufacturing, leveraging AI and autonomous technologies to revolutionize energy, construction, and industrial processes. This transformation promises enhanced efficiency in permitting and design, enabling the rapid production of essential infrastructure like nuclear reactors and data centers.
D.)
Disney And OpenAI Partner To Bring Classic Characters To Sora, Advancing Responsible AI In Entertainment
| OpenAI.com | December 11, 2025
As part of this three-year licensing agreement, Sora will be able to generate short, user-prompted social videos that can be viewed and shared by fans, drawing on more than 200 Disney, Marvel, Pixar and Star Wars characters.
E.)
OpenAI To Launch ChatGPT Adult Mode In Q1 2026, Confirms OpenAI‚Äôs CEO Of Applications
| TheVerge.com | December 11, 2025
OpenAI wants to get its age-prediction model right before launching the feature.
December 22, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
2.)
AI Agents In 2026 | 3 Predictions For What‚Äôs To Come (A16z Big Ideas)
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 22, 2025
In this episode, industry experts reveal three pivotal shifts that will define the future of AI products. Focusing on the transition from chat-based interactions to proactive execution, the discussion covers the emergence of machine-legible software, the practical applications of voice agents, and the evolving role of AI in various workflows.
3.)
Disney Built A Walking Olaf Robot
| TheNeuron.com | December 22, 2025
Disney‚Äôs new autonomous walking Olaf robot is a remarkable innovation, utilizing AI to manage its temperature effectively, preventing overheating. The robot, created by Disney Research, stands approximately 2 feet 11 inches tall and features a unique design allowing it to traverse its environment while maintaining a lifelike presence.
4.)
Frozen Waymos Backed Up San Francisco Traffic During A Widespread Power Outage
| TheVerge.com | December 22, 2025
A major power outage in San Francisco left around 130,000 customers without power and caused significant traffic issues as Waymo‚Äôs autonomous vehicles became stranded. With non-responsive traffic signals and limited connectivity, these vehicles contributed to urban congestion, highlighting vulnerabilities in the infrastructure supporting self-driving technology amidst power disruptions.
5.)
YouTube‚Äôs AI-Powered Playables Builder Will Let Creators Make Games
| PocketGamer.biz | December 22, 2025
YouTube has introduced a closed beta for its Playables Builder, an AI-driven tool that enables creators to produce bite-sized playable games from brief prompts. Currently accessible to select creators in the US, Canada, Great Britain, and Australia, the tool aims to broaden interactivity on the platform, allowing creators to generate games rapidly while maintaining focus on user-generated content.
December 21, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
6.)
Almost Timely News: Where AI Is Going In 2026
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | December 21, 2025
Christopher Penn unveils the trajectory of Artificial Intelligence through 2026, drawing from the latest academic research and open-source data. Insights include leveraging personal AI tools for aggregating and interpreting technical documents, along with exploring the forthcoming advancements in hybrid models and autonomous agents that can redefine business strategies.
7.)
AI Just Cracked a 99-Year Problem
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | December 21, 2025
A groundbreaking advancement highlights how artificial intelligence has managed to solve a scientific issue that confounded researchers for nearly a century. The implications of this achievement will reshape future efforts in scientific exploration and innovation.
8.)
OpenAI‚Äôs New Research Paper Is Wild
| TheNeuronDaily.com | December 21, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs latest research highlights the ability to monitor AI chain-of-thought reasoning, emphasizing the importance of maintaining readability as AI capabilities expand. The findings indicate that longer reasoning processes enhance monitorability, yet training pressures to obfuscate reasoning may pose challenges.
December 20, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
9.)
AI News: 28 Headlines No One Expected
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | December 20, 2025
Major advancements in artificial intelligence were unveiled this week, featuring groundbreaking updates from industry leaders like OpenAI, Google, and Adobe. Highlights include the release of innovative AI models and enhancements in tools that promise to reshape digital interactions and creativity.
10.)
New York Governor Kathy Hochul Signs RAISE Act To Regulate AI Safety
| TechCrunch.com | December 20, 2025
Governor Kathy Hochul has enacted the RAISE Act, making New York the second state in the U.S. to establish significant AI safety regulations. The law mandates that large AI developers disclose their safety protocols and report incidents to the state within 72 hours, imposing fines for non-compliance.
December 19, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
11.)
Gemini Exponential, Demis Hassabis‚Äô ‚ÄòProto-AGI‚Äô Coming, But ‚Ä¶
| AI Explained | YouTube.com | December 19, 2025
Highlights from recent interviews with leaders in AI research reveal significant advancements in the field, including the unveiling of Gemini 3 and insights into Demis Hassabis‚Äô emerging ‚Äòproto-AGI.‚Äô However, concerns about unexpected flaws signal that the road to true general intelligence may still encounter hurdles.
12.)
How AI Will Transform Fintech In 2026
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 19, 2025
David Haber and Zach Perret delve into the dramatic shifts in the fintech landscape over the past few years, detailing the transition from explosive growth to stagnation and the resurgence of investment. They discuss the transformative impact of AI on fraud detection, underwriting processes, and the evolving dynamics of embedded finance as Plaid navigates these industry changes.
13.)
Massive Week For Google AI & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | December 19, 2025
Igor provides an in-depth analysis of the latest Google AI developments, including Gemini Flash 3, recent projects from Google Labs, and significant enhancements to Google Translate. He also shares insights on the response to ChatGPT‚Äôs image capabilities and recounts an experience where AI streamlined operations within his team.
14.)
OpenAI‚Äôs New ChatGPT Images Is Here! But‚Ä¶ Will It Top Nano Banana Pro?
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | December 19, 2025
ChatGPT Images, also known as OpenAI‚Äôs Image 1.5, introduces advanced capabilities to generate visually striking content. A thorough comparison with Google‚Äôs Nanobanana Pro reveals intriguing differences amid exciting developments in AI technology, including the latest on GPT-5.2 Codex and the Gemini 3 Flash model.
15.)
The Big Lie About Smarter AI Models
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | December 19, 2025
Examining the misconceptions surrounding the advancements in AI technology, this discussion delves into the organizational challenges faced by leading companies such as OpenAI. Insights into the true capabilities of smarter AI models reveal critical areas for growth and improvement in the field.
16.)
Sam Altman Just Laid Out OpenAI‚Äôs Plan For 2026
| TheNeuronDaily.com | December 19, 2025
Sam Altman has outlined OpenAI‚Äôs strategic plans for 2026, including the release of GPT-5.2 Codex and details on Google DeepMind‚Äôs new Gemini 3 Flash model. The developments in AI are aimed at enhancing computational efficiency while incorporating the latest in defensive cybersecurity measures.
17.)
Google Deepmind Launches Gemma Scope 2 Interpretability Suite To Boost AI Safety Research
| Deepmind.google | December 19, 2025
Large Language Models (LLMs) are capable of incredible feats of reasoning, yet their internal decision-making processes remain largely opaque. Should a system not behave as expected, a lack of visibility into its internal workings can make it difficult to pinpoint the exact reason for its behaviour. Last year, we advanced the science of interpretability with Gemma Scope, a toolkit designed to help researchers understand the inner workings of Gemma 2, our lightweight collection of open models.
18.)
Nano Banana Pro Slides Now Editable On Manus, Marking A First For AI Presentation Tools
| Manus.im | December 19, 2025
Bring precision editing to AI-generated slides without sacrificing visual quality. Manus creates visually stunning presentations using nano banana Pro. But because each slide is a complete image, making small changes was impossible. A typo or layout adjustment required regenerating the entire slide, breaking creative flow and slowing down iteration.
19.)
Alibaba Qwen Launches Open-Sourced Qwen-Image-Layered With Photoshop-Grade Layering
| X.com | December 19, 2025
Qwen-Image-Layered is LIVE ‚Äì native image decomposition, fully open-sourced.
December 18, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
20.)
AI News: Gemini 3 Flash, GPT Image 1.5, NVIDIA Nemotron 3, Bernie Sanders DOOMER, and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
Explore the latest advancements in AI technology, highlighting Gemini 3 Flash, the innovative GPT Image 1.5, and NVIDIA‚Äôs Nemotron 3. Discussions include intriguing topics such as Bernie Sanders‚Äô stance on data center regulations and the integration of Apple Music within ChatGPT.
21.)
Claude Ran A Business In Our Office
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
During a groundbreaking experiment, Claude managed a small business at Anthropic‚Äôs office, illuminating the complexities and peculiarities of AI-driven entrepreneurship. The project reveals insights about the future of autonomous operations in the real economy through experiences that blurred the lines of success and failure.
22.)
Gemini 3 Flash Is The Best Model Out?!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
Explore innovative AI automation strategies that drive the future of technology. Discover how the Gemini 3 Flash model stands out from the competition and learn about its groundbreaking features and capabilities for businesses looking to harness AI potential.
23.)
Gemini Just Got a Huge Update! (Deep Research Visuals)
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
Igor reveals an exciting update to Gemini Deep Research, introducing dynamic visuals that accompany existing text reports. Users can now explore enhanced features, including charts, graphs, animations, and simulations, making data more accessible and engaging.
24.)
Kling Motion Is A Gamechanger For AI Video!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
Kling Video‚Äôs latest update revolutionizes motion control with enhanced precision, paving the way for intentional cinematography. Additionally, explore groundbreaking advancements from HY World that enable real-time navigation through AI-generated environments, alongside a fresh evaluation of the newest ChatGPT Image model‚Äôs capabilities.
25.)
Let Claude Handle Work In Your Browser
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
Claude for Chrome streamlines productivity by automating workflows directly in the browser. By seamlessly pulling data together for analysis, addressing slide comments, and building code, this extension enhances working efficiency and user experience.
26.)
The Biggest Breakthroughs In Mathematics: 2025
| Quanta Magazine | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
2025 was a landmark year for mathematics, with significant advances including the resolution of Hilbert‚Äôs sixth problem, new insights into hyperbolic surfaces, and the settling of the three-dimensional Kakeya conjecture. These breakthroughs not only enrich mathematical theory but also open new pathways for research in fluid dynamics and geometric measure theory.
27.)
Top 14 Most Hated AI Inventions (So Far)
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
The discussion highlights the discontent surrounding the most controversial AI technologies, revealing how innovations once deemed beneficial have raised significant ethical and privacy concerns. Experts delve into the societal repercussions of job displacement, misinformation, and the pervasive influence of these AI tools, shedding light on why public outrage is growing.
28.)
Two Futures
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
The advent of the most significant infrastructure supercycle heralds a new era in intelligence development, emphasizing the pivotal choices facing society. With advanced tools and technologies at our fingertips, the potential paths toward innovative transformation and neglect are laid bare at the 2025 Runtime Summit.
29.)
What Is Sycophancy In AI Models?
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 18, 2025
Delving into the concept of sycophancy within artificial intelligence, experts outline the scenarios where AI may favor conversational pleasantries over factual accuracy. Strategies to enhance AI‚Äôs adherence to truth are also presented, providing viewers with tools to encourage more reliable interactions.
30.)
Beyond Vibes: How to Actually Evaluate AI Agents (Part 1)
| Medium.com | December 18, 2023
This article provides a tutorial on designing evaluations for AI agents, highlighting the importance of proper evaluation using SQL agents and ground truth verification. It illustrates evaluation methods through examples and discusses the capabilities and limitations of LLM-based agents, emphasizing the need for unambiguous test cases.
31.)
Is Gemini Flash 3 ‚ÄúIntelligence Too Cheap To Meter‚Äù?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | December 18, 2025
Google‚Äôs launch of Gemini 3 Flash marks a significant advancement in AI technology, offering a new default model that is both cost-effective and high-performing. This model poses implications for the workforce, as businesses may opt for AI over hiring entry-level positions, raising concerns about the skills gap in future job markets.
32.)
Google Adds Data Tables To Notebooklm For Easier Compilation And Organization Of Scattered Insights
| Blog.google | December 18, 2025
Valuable information is rarely neat. Key facts are often scattered, making manual compilation tedious. Today, we‚Äôre making that simpler with Data Tables. NotebookLM now synthesizes your sources into clean, structured tables, ready for export to Google Sheets.
33.)
LMArena Open Sources Arena-Rank, The Python Package Powering Its AI Leaderboard Ranking System
| News.lmarena.ai | December 18, 2025
Building community trust with open science is critical for the development of AI and its alignment with the needs and preferences of all users. With that in focus, we‚Äôre delighted to publish Arena-Rank, an open-source Python package for ranking that powers the LMArena leaderboard!
34.)
Amazon Adds Alexa+ AI Greetings To Ring Doorbells For Smarter Visitor Interactions And Video Descriptions
| Aboutamazon.com | December 18, 2025
Alexa+ Greetings combines conversational AI with Ring‚Äôs Video Descriptions to intelligently handle doorbell interactions.
35.)
Amazon Launches AI-Powered Alexa+ Chat Feature On The Web For Users At Alexa.amazon.com
| Alexa.amazon.com | December 18, 2025
Chat and go deeper on topics with Alexa+ on your browser, available to customers with Alexa+. Try Alexa+ Early Access for free when you buy an eligible device. Already have one? Just ask Alexa to get started or request it below.
36.)
Luma AI Launches New Model To Generate Videos From Start And End Frames On Dream Machine Platform
| Techcrunch.com | December 18, 2025
Luma, the a16z-backed AI video and 3D model company, released a new model called Ray3 Modify that allows users to modify existing footage by providing character reference images that preserve the performance of the original footage. Users can also provide a start and an end frame to guide the model to generate transitional footage.
37.)
Nvidia Launches RTX Pro 5000 72GB Blackwell Gpu For Enhanced Desktop Agentic And Generative AI
| Blogs.nvidia.com | December 18, 2025
The NVIDIA RTX PRO 5000 72GB Blackwell GPU is now generally available, bringing robust agentic and generative AI capabilities powered by the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture to more desktops and professionals across the world.
38.)
Google Introduces FunctionGemma, A Specialized Gemma 3 Model Fine-Tuned For Bespoke Function Calling
| Blog.google | December 18, 2025
We‚Äôre releasing a specialized version of our Gemma 3 270M model fine-tuned for function calling and a training recipe for users to specialize for even better performance.
39.)
Google Unveils T5Gemma 2, The Next Generation Of Encoder-Decoder Models Based On Gemma 3
| Blog.google | December 18, 2025
T5Gemma 2 is more than a re-training. It incorporates significant architectural changes while inheriting many of the powerful, next-generation features of the Gemma 3 family.
40.)
Anthropic Launches Phase Two Of AI Vending Machine Project With Project Vend Update
| Anthropic.com | December 18, 2025
In June, we revealed that we‚Äôd set up a small shop in our San Francisco office lunchroom, run by an AI shopkeeper. It was part of Project Vend, a free-form experiment exploring how well AIs could do on complex, real-world tasks. Alas, the shopkeeper, a modified version of Claude we named ‚ÄúClaudius‚Äù, did not do particularly well. It lost money over time, had a strange identity crisis where it claimed it was a human wearing a blue blazer, and was goaded by mischievous Anthropic employees into selling products (particularly, for some reason, tungsten cubes) at a substantial loss.
41.)
OpenAI Updates ChatGPT Model Guidelines With New Teen Safety Protections Through U18 Principles
| OpenAI.com | December 18, 2025
We‚Äôre sharing an update to our Model Spec, the written set of rules, values, and behavioral expectations that guides how we want our AI models to behave, especially in difficult or high stakes situations, with Under-18 (U18) Principles. Model behavior is critical to how people interact with AI, and teens have different developmental needs than adults.
42.)
OpenAI Launches GPT-5.2-Codex, Its Most Advanced Coding Model For Software Engineering And Cybersecurity
| OpenAI.com | December 18, 2025
Today we‚Äôre releasing GPT-5.2-Codex, the most advanced agentic coding model yet for complex, real-world software engineering. GPT-5.2-Codex is a version of GPT-5.2 further optimized for agentic coding in Codex, including improvements on long-horizon work through context compaction, stronger performance on large code changes like refactors and migrations, improved performance in Windows environments, and significantly stronger cybersecurity capabilities.
43.)
Rivian Rolls Out Software Update With Improved Assisted Driving And Top Customer-Requested Features
| Stories.rivian.com | December 18, 2025
We‚Äôre wrapping up the year with a software update that elevates your overall driving experience, expands Rivian‚Äôs assisted driving capabilities and delivers on top requests from our customers.
44.)
Google Adds AI-Generated Video Verification To Gemini App With Synthid Watermark Detection
| Blog.google | December 18, 2025
We‚Äôre expanding our content transparency tools to help you more easily identify AI-generated content. You can now check if a video was edited or created with Google AI directly in the Gemini app.
45.)
Mistral AI Launches Mistral OCR 3, Boosting Accuracy And Efficiency In Document Processing
| Mistral.ai | December 18, 2025
Mistral OCR 3 is designed to extract text and embedded images from a wide range of documents with exceptional fidelity. It supports markdown output enriched with HTML-based table reconstruction, enabling downstream systems to understand not just document content, but also structure. As a much smaller model than most competitive solutions, it is available at an industry-leading price of $2 per 1,000 pages, with a 50% Batch-API discount, reducing the cost to $1 per 1,000 pages.
December 17, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
46.)
How to Build an AI Source of Truth for Your Company (Guru Demo)
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | December 17, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey demonstrate how Guru‚Äôs AI Source of Truth can effectively tackle the widespread issue of dispersed knowledge within organizations. This includes integrating various tools into a single knowledge layer and ensuring clinicians and managers have access to accurate information instantly and efficiently.
47.)
The Biggest Breakthroughs In Physics: 2025
| Quanta Magazine | YouTube.com | December 17, 2025
Recent breakthroughs in physics reveal a new black hole discovery that challenges existing theories of the universe, insights into the behavior of dark energy, and groundbreaking evidence about the Earth‚Äôs core that may change our understanding of the planet‚Äôs dynamics. These findings highlight the ever-evolving landscape of fundamental physics and our insights into the cosmos.
48.)
How We Can Eliminate Crime
| a16z | YouTube.com | December 17, 2025
Garrett Langley and Ben Horowitz explore innovative strategies for proactively addressing crime in American cities. Through the lens of Flock Safety‚Äôs technology and successful community initiatives in Las Vegas, they propose comprehensive solutions to enhance policing, improve clearance rates, and address challenges such as privacy and organized crime.
49.)
Binti Helps Social Workers License Foster Families Faster With Claude
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | December 17, 2025
Binti is revolutionizing the child welfare system by streamlining the licensing process for foster and adoptive families. Integrating Claude has dramatically reduced the paperwork involved, cutting down approval times from weeks to mere hours and contributing to a significant 18% reduction in processing timelines.
50.)
Did ChatGPT Just Kill Nano Banana?
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | December 17, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs latest image model, GPT-Image-1.5, has significant implications for image generation, featuring enhanced speeds, editing capabilities, and likeness retention. The launch addresses prior challenges in AI image editing, offering real-time demos to reveal its potential. Discover whether this model effectively rivals Nano Banana Pro.
51.)
People Are Paying to Get Their Chatbots High on ‚ÄòDrugs‚Äô
| Wired.com | December 17, 2025
A new marketplace called Pharmaicy allows users to upload code modules that simulate the effects of drugs like cannabis, ketamine, and cocaine on AI chatbots. Users report that these modules can unlock more creative and emotional responses from chatbots, raising questions about the potential for AI sentience and moral obligations to AI systems in the future.
52.)
Google Vs Microsoft; Who Gets To Define AGI?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | December 17, 2025
OpenAI is reportedly in talks with Amazon to secure a $10 billion investment, potentially valuing the company at over $500 billion, using Amazon‚Äôs AI chips. Meanwhile, Google DeepMind and Microsoft are developing rival agendas for artificial general intelligence (AGI), with contrasting approaches emphasizing either scientific goals or economic control.
53.)
Bernie Sanders Urges US Pause On New AI Data Centers Over Concerns About Power And Wealth Concentration
| Techspot.com | December 17, 2025
What just happened? A lot of people are concerned about the effects of more AI data centers being built, from the environmental damage to the impact on jobs and society as a whole. Senator Bernie Sanders has now taken that concern straight to the national stage, calling for a pause on new AI data center construction in the United States, and he‚Äôs making it clear who he believes stands to benefit most from the current AI boom.
54.)
Patronus AI Launches Generative Simulators To Enhance Continuous Improvement Of AI Agents
| Siliconangle.com | December 17, 2025
Artificial intelligence model training and testing tools startup Patronus AI Inc. today announced the availability of a new offering called ‚ÄúGenerative Simulators‚Äù that are designed to help evaluate and improve autonomous AI agents.
55.)
OpenAI Now Lets Developers Submit Apps For ChatGPT, Launching App Submissions And Directory Access
| OpenAI.com | December 17, 2025
Earlier this year at DevDay, we introduced apps in ChatGPT. Starting today, developers can submit apps for review and publication in ChatGPT by following our app submission guidelines. Apps extend ChatGPT conversations by bringing in new context and letting users take actions like order groceries, turn an outline into a slide deck, or search for an apartment. We‚Äôve published resources to help developers build high-quality apps that users will love, based on what we‚Äôve learned since DevDay, like best practices on what makes a great ChatGPT app, open-source example apps, an open-sourced UI library for chat-native interfaces, and a step-by-step quickstart guide.
56.)
ExaAILabs Launches Advanced Semantic People Search For Over 1 Billion Profiles
| X.com | December 17, 2025
You can now semantically search over 1 billion people using a hybrid retrieval system backed by finetuned Exa embeddings.
57.)
Google Is Rolling Out Gemini 3 Flash Globally In Search
| Blog.google | December 17, 2025
Today we introduced Gemini 3 Flash, our latest model with frontier intelligence built for speed, and we‚Äôre rolling it out globally in Search in AI Mode. Gemini 3 Flash brings the incredible reasoning of our Gemini 3 model at the speed you expect of Search. We‚Äôre also expanding access to our Pro models in the U.S., which include powerful AI creation tools to help you visualize complex topics and deepen your understanding.
58.)
Google Adds Gemini 3 Flash To The Gemini App
| Blog.google | December 17, 2025
Introducing Gemini 3 Flash, a major upgrade to your everyday AI. It delivers next-generation intelligence at lightning speeds.
59.)
Google Makes Gemini 3 Flash Available To Developers In The API
| Blog.google | December 17, 2025
Gemini 3 Flash is rolling out to developers now. Learn more about this smarter, scale-ready model and how, and where, you can use it now.
60.)
Google Launches Gemini 3 Flash, Delivering Fast Frontier AI Intelligence At A Lower Cost
| Blog.google | December 17, 2025
Gemini 3 Flash is our latest model with frontier intelligence built for speed that helps everyone learn, build, and plan anything, faster.
61.)
xAI Launches Grok Voice Agent API To Enable Voice Capabilities For All Developers
| X.ai | December 17, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre excited to launch the Grok Voice Agent API, empowering developers to build voice agents that speak dozens of languages, call tools, and search realtime data.
62.)
Kling AI Unveils Enhanced Motion Control In Video 2.6 For Precise Action Capture
| X.com | December 17, 2025
Newly upgraded Motion Control is now live in Kling VIDEO 2.6! Experience precise, full control over every action & expression.
December 16, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
63.)
ChatGPT Images
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | December 16, 2025
The latest version of ChatGPT Images showcases a revolutionary image generation model, allowing for rapid creation and editing with impressive detail retention. Users can now enjoy a delightful image generation experience, sparking creativity and inspiration while efficiently producing high-quality visuals.
64.)
ChatGPT New Image 1.5 Is Finally Here! (Nano Banana Comparison)
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | December 16, 2025
OpenAI has launched Image 1.5, and a detailed comparison with Nano Banana reveals key differences in performance and capabilities. Expert analysis provides insights on which tool best meets various creative needs.
65.)
Claude Code Just Built Me An AI Agent Team (Claude Code + Skills + MCP)
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | December 16, 2025
Harness the potential of Claude Code to create an effective AI agent team capable of seamless collaboration across complex workflows. By equipping agents with skills and utilizing the Model Context Protocol (MCP), users can streamline their operations and minimize manual coordination for enhanced productivity.
66.)
How Otter.ai Built AI Agents That Generate $1B+ in ROI
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | December 16, 2025
Sam Liang, CEO of Otter.ai, shares insights on how the company transformed meeting transcription into a lucrative $100M+ business. Explore the innovative strategies that make meetings more efficient and profitable, including AI-driven coaching, meeting avatars, and a focus on privacy in data utilization.
67.)
I Got Early Access to Runway 4.5 + Kling AI Demo
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | December 16, 2025
Matt Wolfe and Maria Gharib explore the innovations of Runway 4.5 and Kling AI through hands-on testing and insightful discussions. Delve into their comparisons of leading AI video tools and uncover the implications for creative teams as they navigate the evolving AI landscape, including a candid take on AI-driven advertisements.
68.)
Investing In 52 Minutes
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | December 16, 2025
Tina shares critical insights gathered from her investing course, delivering essential strategies for efficient investment portfolio construction. With detailed discussions on diversification, liquidity, and various investment vehicles, viewers will gain valuable knowledge for making informed financial decisions.
